text:
IT’S the biggest night in fashion - but with any costume party, there’s bound to be some frocky horror shows.

As usual people flocked to social media to mock stars’ outfits as they hit the Met Gala 2018 red carpet, The Sun reports.

MORE: Best and worst dressed — and the barely-there Met Gala gowns

She's literally dressed as the "me at your funeral" meme 👑#MetGala pic.twitter.com/lEYnHHnUec — Madonna | FOTP (@FOTPMadonnaNews) May 8, 2018

Everyone else should just go home. Katy Perry won the #MetGala pic.twitter.com/r1aIksAOcO — Tyler Layne (@TylerLayneMusic) May 8, 2018

This year’s theme for the fundraising event in New York was “Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and the Catholic Imagination”.

It was selected to pay tribute to the masterworks of religious art in the museum through the medium of fashion.

Naturally, when you’ve got celebrities dressing as the Pope (we’re looking at you, Rihanna) and sporting a fake tan that President Trump would be proud of, the memes came thick and fast.

Best and worst stars dressed at the 2018 Met Gala media_camera Rihanna attends the Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and The Catholic Imagination Costume Institute Gala at The Metropolitan Museum of Art on May 7, 2018 in New York City. Picture: AP 1 of 105 media_camera Rihanna attends the Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and The Catholic Imagination Costume Institute Gala at The Metropolitan Museum of Art on May 7, 2018 in New York City. Picture: Getty 2 of 105 media_camera Katy Perry attends the Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and The Catholic Imagination Costume Institute Gala at The Metropolitan Museum of Art on May 7, 2018 in New York City. Picture: Getty Images 3 of 105 media_camera Kim Kardashian attends the Heavenly Bodies: Fashion and The Catholic Imagination Costume Institute Gala at The Metropolitan Museum of Art on May 7, 2018 in New York City. Picture: Getty Images 4 of 105 nav_small_close Want to see more?( 101 more photos in collection )Continue to full gallery nav_small_left nav_small_right

Many likened Selena Gomez’s bronze glow to the US president, while others compared her to Ross from Friends and SpongeBob Squarepants.

These spot the difference games are getting harder.. #MetGala pic.twitter.com/bvFXheBwz2 — izet ⛈ (@aerglos) May 8, 2018

remember tannned patrick and spongebob? well this is them now, feeling old yet? #metgala pic.twitter.com/r1txo6zVYP — ri || 34 (@inspieres) May 8, 2018

Beyonce sparked a media storm when she announced she’d be giving the event a miss - four years after that moment when her sister Solange attacked her husband Jay-Z in a lift.

But one cheeky Twitter user suggested she had made an appearance after all - as the Holy Ghost.

Meanwhile RiRi’s “Pope” attire had many fans aspiring to convert to Catholicism.

White smoke new Pope pic.twitter.com/Ccp6gbYCsC — Caroline Moss (@socarolinesays) May 7, 2018

Kim Kardashian put her killer curves on display in a striking gold Versace gown as she attended without husband Kanye West for the second year in a row.

Though one Twitter user compared her “heavenly body” to a bejewelled golden chalice.

Another mocked model Cindy Crawford for appearing to pay little homage to the theme - other than the “Heavenly Body” part.

it's like cindy only saw "heavenly bodies" on the invite and was like "neat theme" and stopped reading there pic.twitter.com/npYBWDXfNN — rachel syme (@rachsyme) May 7, 2018

And one pointed out actress Frances McDormand’s headpiece looked like she was promoting her new film: “Free Bluebirds Outside A-Big Museum”.

Frances McDormand, Oscar winner for Free Bluebirds Outside A-Big Museum pic.twitter.com/4tbPPKJtQp — Louis Virtel (@louisvirtel) May 7, 2018

Pregnant American rapper Cardi B got a bit of stick for her elaborate head crown, which one person likened to the Starbucks logo.

Another suggested her look was a budget version of Beyonce’s striking gold Grammys 2017 outfit which showed off her growing baby bump.

They posted contrasting snaps of the two singers, writing: “When you order something online vs when it arrives.”

Another Twitter user made the same joke about Zendaya’s and Shailene Woodley’s Joan of Arc costumes.

when you order it online vs when it comes in the mail #MetGala pic.twitter.com/BBx8KrWQmh — Tyler McCall (@eiffeltyler) May 8, 2018

these spot the difference games are getting harder 😰 #MetGala pic.twitter.com/5qqEfS4UED — yana! (@smctwn) May 8, 2018

Last night Jaden Smith was mocked after he brought his own gold disc onto the red carpet at the Met Gala.

Jaden Smith #MetGala watch 👀

Damn...

2016: Brings his sister

2017: Brings his own hair

2018: Brings his album's Gold certification #Icon 🔥🔥🔥 pic.twitter.com/TC2ZmpzTpY — Ndivhu M Photography🇿🇦 (@Ndivhu_M_) May 8, 2018

These were the Met Gala 2018 red carpet’s cutest couples – from Kylie Jenner and Travis Scott, to Gisele and Tom Brady.

Someone told Tom Brady that the Met Gala theme was “Every Nicolas Cage Villain from 1990-1997" pic.twitter.com/ARuvcUNR14 — Jason O. Gilbert (@gilbertjasono) May 8, 2018

And this is the reason Blake Lively’s Met Gala dress took more than 600 hours to make.

It looks like those 600+ hours spent on Blake Lively's #MetGala gown were well worth it. pic.twitter.com/lToKct5NCd — E! News (@enews) May 8, 2018

This article originally appeared in The Sun and is republished here with permission.

Cardi B rocking pearls for the 2018 Met Gala (@Skillzypro) Cardi B rocking pearls for the 2018 Met Gala (@Skillzypro)

Originally published as This year’s best Met Gala memes
title: Met Gala 2018: Best memes of Madonna, Katy Perry, Kardshians

meta_data.description: WHILE some live for the fashion at the annual Met Gala, others simply cant wait for the memes that follow the fashion. Here are this years best quips.

News, Starbucks Corporation, Cindy Crawford, Travis Scott, Joan of Arc, Kim Kardashian, Solange, Frances McDormand, Jaden Smith, Jason O. Gilbert, Tom Brady, Jay Z, Kris Jenner, Katy Perry, Madonna, Tyler McCall, Trump
